# GroupSessionEvent.Action

**Structure**

A playback-related change that occurs during the session.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Action
```

## Overview

Use this structure to communicate playback-related changes to participants using the system UI. You can use this structure to communicate the following types of events:

- Transport-related events for a custom player.
- Changes to a playback queue your app manages.

When a change occurs in your custom player or playback queue, create an instance of this structure to describe the change and wrap it in a [doc://com.apple.GroupActivities/documentation/GroupActivities/GroupSessionEvent] structure. To display the event to the participant call the [doc://com.apple.GroupActivities/documentation/GroupActivities/GroupSession/showNotice(_:)] method of the session. The system formats and displays the information you provide.



## Getting playback-related actions

- **play**: An action that indicates the start of playback.
- **pause**: An action that indicates an end to playback.
- **seek**: An event that indicates a change to the current playback location.
- **skip(item:)**: Returns an event that indicates a skipped track or playback item.

## Getting change-related actions

- **updatedQueue(_:)**: Returns an action that represents a change to the playback queue.
- **updatedQueue**: An action that represents a nonspecific change to the queue.
- **GroupSessionEvent.Action.QueueChange**: A type that describes a modification to the playback queue.

## Getting the event details

- **originator**: The participant that initiated the event.
- **url**: The URL to open when the participant taps the event link in the system UI.
- **action**: The reason for the event.
